items.title: Frontend Developer - Build the smartest way to buy a car (full time)
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=26, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=3, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=40}
items.content:
Frontend Developer - Build the smartest way to buy a car (full time)

Company: Unhaggle Inc.

Unhaggle is currently the #1 web portal in Canada for new car buying. The data we provide powers our own tools and products, including our flagship consumer car buying service at Unhaggle.com and leading automotive portals including Yahoo Autos, MSN Autos, Autofocus, AutoGuide, Globe Drive, and others. We have also recently partnered with auto makers to launch a large eCommerce platform allowing the complete purchase of new cars online.

We are looking for Senior Front-end Developers with experience in web application development. This is a full-time remote position, we accept applications from anywhere in the world.

We use GitHub to manage tasks and code reviews as well as tools/services like Travis-CI, Docker, New Relic, Sentry, Browserstack, Stripe, Twilio, Solr and Redis.
Our dev team is regularly connected in Slack for communication. We are constantly seeking the best tools available for our development team.

You will be primarily involved in the following projects/areas:

* Our new eCommerce platform for new car buying, serving major car brands
* Our web portal unhaggle.com
* Several web products we built for Enterprise clients.
* Widgets we built for third-party integration, they run in some of the most popular auto websites in Canada.
* We take quality seriously and you should expect to be involved in well written code bases following industry standards and good software development practices.

Requirements:

* At least 3 years of Javascript professional experience.
* Strong web development experience: we expect that you know XHTML, CSS and Javascript well. Hands on experience with Javascript frameworks is a big plus
* Proficient and hands on experience with responsive web sites, including the Bootstrap library.
* You care about writing semantic well formed code and paying attention to standards and good practices.
* Experience using version control software, Git is a plus.
* Track record of delivering completed projects, preferably web-based.
* Easy-going personality. You will actively participate in design discussions and code review.
* Any previous experience with Django or Django templates is a big plus.

Bonus:

* Some experience with Linux is a big plus. You will be asked to deploy changes to our dev machines that are based in Linux (Ubuntu server). 
* Some experience with Python and/or experience with Django would be a big plus.

We are helping consumers to get the best price on new cars in Canada and changing the industry along the way. Working at Unhaggle brings unique challenges, you will have the opportunity to leave a large footprint and have real impact in the product we ship every day to our customers.

No relocation available, we are a distributed team.

How to apply:
Please submit resume and cover letter to evandro@unhaggle.com

items.title: Special Counsel, EEO
tags: DBG:surround``3N( OR(feasibl,OR(consid,consider),option,occas,opportun,possibl,abil), OR(3N(remot, work),telecommut,2N(work,home)) ) NOT OR(regularli, abracadabra)
items.content:
Special Counsel, EEO at Ogletree Deakins

Remote | Part-time

Location: Indianapolis

Position: Counsel

Seniority Level: Mid-Senior level

Overview:

Ogletree Deakins is one of the largest labor and employment law firms representing management in all types of employment-related legal matters. The firm has approximately 850 lawyers located in 53 offices across the United States, Canada, Europe and Mexico. Ogletree Deakins has been named a Law Firm of the Year for seven consecutive years by U.S. News Best Lawyers Best Law Firms. In 2018, the publication named Ogletree Deakins its Law Firm of the Year in the Litigation – Labor & Employment category. In addition to handling labor and employment law matters, the firm has thriving practices focused on business immigration, employee benefits, and workplace safety and health law. Ogletree Deakins represents a diverse range of clients, from small businesses to Fortune 50 companies.

We have a unique opportunity for an experienced employment defense attorney to join our EEO Advantage Administrative Charges team as a Special Counsel attorney. The Special Counsel attorney will focus on handling administrative charges before federal, state and local agencies, including investigation, assessment and development of risk strategies, client interaction and preparation of persuasive position statements.

The Special Counsel attorney will have a flexible part-time schedule with the ability to work from home. Candidates who apply should have extensive experience in preparing position statements in connection with large law firm or in-house practice. This position will primarily support our Indianapolis office but may be based out of any location.

We are fully committed to the importance of diversity within the legal profession, as well as all workplace environments and strongly encourage the interest of diverse candidates in the firm.

Requirements:

  • Juris Doctor. Qualified candidates must be and remain licensed to practice law and in good standing in the state of employment. During employment, must meet requirements for continuing licensure for law practice.
  • 8+ years of recent experience preparing position statements required, either in-house or at a large law firm.
  • Significant management-side labor & employment experience required.
  • Superior analytical and writing skills required.

Please note, a writing sample is required to be considered for the Special Counsel role (a redacted position statement writing sample is preferred).

Apply for job

items.content:
Online Tutor at Brainfuse

Remote | Freelance

Who We Are

Brainfuse (www.brainfuse.com) is a nationally recognized eLearning corporation. Founded in 1999, Brainfuse is one of the nation’s leading online education providers, serving a diverse client base of libraries, school districts, workforce centers, and universities.

Who We Are Looking For

Brainfuse is hiring tutors in all subjects. Since this is an online tutoring position, applicants will need to have their own computers and a stable Internet connection.

We are especially looking for Physics, Chem, Stats, Oracle SQL and Earth Science tutors!

Subjects that we are hiring for:

  • Science: Biology, Microbiology, Chemistry, Organic Chemistry, Physics, Earth, and more.
  • Math: Algebra, Geometry, Trigonometry, Precalculus, Calculus, Statistics, and more.
  • Business: Accounting, Economics, and Finance.
  • Computer: Java, JavaScript, Cloud Computing, PHP/MySQL, PERL/CGI, Advanced Visual Basic, C++, HTML, Information Technology, A+, Security +, CCNA, CCNA Security, Linux+, Excel, PowerPoint, and Access.

How It Works

You can work from your own home or anywhere with an internet connection. Live tutoring is done through a virtual whiteboard and chat box so no webcam or mic is required. For more information on how it works, please visit www.brainfuse.com.

Scheduling is flexible, and you choose your own hours. There are also opportunities for advancement. *If interested, please reply to this ad with your resume attached and mention which subjects you are applying for.

Apply for job

items.content:
Assessor at BTS

Remote | Part-time

Job Description

We are always looking for assessors to join our expanding team. As projects arise, we will contact candidates with the appropriate qualifications.

Individuals will be responsible for conducting phone and web-based role play exercises, providing competency based behavioral benchmark scoring for each exercise, and evaluating each participant’s performance. They will also be responsible for delivering feedback to a representative of the hiring organization immediately following the assessment.

This is a virtual role, so qualified candidates may work from any location.

Required Skills

  • A Master’s Degree in Industrial/Organizational Psychology, or related field, is required. I/O Psych PhD students who do not possess an I/O Psych Master’s will also be considered.
  • You must be available for two full days per week (Monday-Friday; no weekends) during extended business hours to commit to this long term project. More than two days per week of availability is preferred.
  • Previous experience as an assessor, coach, role player, with business simulations, or other individual or group behavioral assessments, is highly desirable
  • Please include a cover letter with a description of relevant experience, alongside your resume/CV
  • All candidates must be eligible to work in the United States permanently without sponsorship

Job Location: Work From Home, United States

Position Type: Part-Time

Apply for job

items.title: Hospital Coder
items.content:
Hospital Coder at Seattle Children's

Remote

Job ID 2018-26347

Area of Interest: Medical Records

Location Name: Other Off-Site Location

FTE/Hours per pay period: 1.0 FTE (80 hours per bi-weekly pay periods)

Work Status: Regular

Department: Revenue Integrity & Coding

Shift: Day Shift

Overview

What you will do: Under general supervision, the Hospital Coder Advanced is responsible for the collection of relevant, pertinent, accurate and timely diagnosis and/or procedural codes abstracted from all hospital case types including complex medical/surgical inpatient cases (such as neonates, pediatric cardiac surgery, pediatric cycle accounts, etc.) or other advanced types of services including surgical, observation, outpatient in a bed, and specialty procedures. This includes effective use of hospital encoding systems and resources as well as recognizing what data can be abstracted, presented and interpreted for effective use throughout the hospital data cycle. Performs other duties as assigned, which may include training others.

Due to given business needs candidate hired will telecommute, work from home.

Position/Employer Highlights

  • Flexible work schedule/hours-ability to work on weekends pick up shift differential
  • Comprehensive Benefits Package. We pay 100% of the premiums for dependent children, up to their 26th birthday

Requirements

Required Education/Experience:

  • Associates Degree or two years’ college coursework in Health Information Management or equivalent.
  • Minimum of 5 years hospital based coding experience.
  • Minimum of 2 years hospital based coding experience at Seattle Childrens Hospital for internal applicants.

Required Credentials:

  • One of the following credentials is required: AHIMA – Certified Coding Specialist (CCS), AHIMA – Certified Coding Specialist- Physician (CCS-P), AAPC- Certified Outpatient Coder (COC), AAPC- Certified Professional Coder (CPC).

Preferred:

  • RHIT or RHIA Certified thru AHIMA.
Apply for job

items.title: SVP of Finance
items.content:
SVP of Finance

Worldwide
Company: Crossover

FULL-TIME

Overview

We’re running an Exclusive Hiring Event on this coming Saturday to hire Senior Vice Presidents of Finance ($400K/yr).

This event will include all testing for the role. Upon grading the deliverables from the event, we will set up qualified candidates with an interview with the hiring manager. This is a 100% remote, full-time role.

Do you have what it takes to be a successful SVP Finance in a fast-paced cloud-based network environment where you will manage a world-class team of 100+ finance professionals? This senior role requires critical thinking, inspirational leadership, and excellent communication skills.

Candidate Requirements:

  • 15 years of US GAAP experience in a senior finance management position of a company with international operations.
  • 3+ years experience of proficiently managing teams exceeding 100 finance professionals.
  • Previous responsibility for $500 million-1 billion (annualized) turnover in a software company.
  • A successful track record as the CFO for a software company or SVP for a software division.
  • Experience managing a complex group audit – Big 4 or client side.
  • Extensive US GAAP exposure, ASC 606 implementation experience a bonus M&A accounting and finance experience, including complex multi-currency consolidations
  • Extensive experience with large-scale ERP systems – Netsuite and/or Intacct a bonus
  • Proven team leader with the ability to work to tight deadlines in a faced-paced environment.
  • English language proficiency

We recommend that you attend the event instead of applying online, as our Saturday event process will be much faster.

Register HERE: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/svp-of-finance-400kyr-exclusive-hiring-event-registration-48422260284?aff=funRomRemoteAge

Apply for job

items.title: Virtual Scheduler
tags: DBG:surround``OR(eastern, east, est, edt, newyork) 3W OR(time,timezon)
items.content:
Virtual Scheduler at Milrich Virtual Professionals

Remote | Freelance | Part-time

Position Type: Independent Contractor

  • Availability Needed: At least a possible 4-hour block Monday through Friday between the hours of 9am-5pm
  • Number of Hours per week: 5-40
  • Minimum availability of 20-30 hours each week during normal business hours is preferred
  • Compensation: starts at $10/hr

Milrich Virtual Professionals, LLC is currently looking for Virtual Schedulers. Schedulers will be making calls on behalf of financial and insurance wholesalers to set up appointments for them with advisors. These may be cold calls and would require the scheduler to successfully navigate through a possible gatekeeper via phone and email to reach the financial advisor or the individual who handles the advisor’s calendar.

Your work week will be Monday through Friday, with work hours being between 9am-5pm. You especially need to be available during normal business hours in the morning to qualify for this position based on your geographic location. Some consideration may be given to Eastern Time Zone with morning and early afternoon availability.

Responsibilities:

  • Schedule appointments via phone and email for wholesalers to meet with advisors
  • Respond to emails/calls within one hour during 9am-5pm (most cases can be done from a smartphone)
  • Participate in team conference calls every other week on Thursdays at 11am PT

Desired skills:

  • Able to navigate between email, call log, call list, online phone system, online mapping system and wholesaler’s calendar without getting flustered
  • Attention to detail
  • Proficient in Google docs, knowledge of Excel, Word, and Outlook extremely helpful
  • Sales experience a plus

Requirements

  • Very comfortable making cold calls
  • Not easily rejected
  • Able to work independently and in a partnership with a wholesaler
  • Able to pass background check
  • Cheerful phone disposition
  • Able to talk on phone for 1-4 hours at a time with no interruptions (children, animals, etc.)
  • Good internet connection
  • Good phone connection (may use cell phone)
  • Computer skills: Able to troubleshoot when systems are not working properly, know how to open an Excel spreadsheet and copy the information into another program

Please apply directly to ashton@wmmschedulers.com

Apply for job

items.title: Online English Teacher
items.content:
Online English Teacher at Qkids

Remote | Freelance | Part-time

Position Details 

Position title: Online English Teacher
Rate: $16-20 USD/hr (2 lessons)
Location: Remote, online (U.S. and Canada)
Start date: Immediately
Contract type: Independent Contractor
Contract term: Flexible

Your Work 

  • Teach English to young learners between 5-12 years of age through our online platform
  • Our Class Coordination Team will handle scheduling and student assignment
  • Teachers will be teaching classrooms with up to 4 students
  • The curriculum is preset, no lesson planning required
  • Each in-lesson time is 30 minutes
  • Training and support provided

Requirements 

  • Eligible to legally work in the U.S. or Canada
  • Earned a Bachelor’s degree or currently enrolled in a university program
  • Digital literacy and the ability to lead an engaging learning atmosphere
  • Prior teaching experience or equivalent in education, tutoring, mentoring, homeschooling preferred
  • English teaching certificates (TESOL, TEFL, CELTA, ESL) preferred
  • Technical requirements: a computer with stable internet connection and clear audio/video capacity
  • The minimum time commitment is 6 hours weekly

Regular class time slots: 19 hrs

7 days a week (AM – EST):
6:40-7:10, 7:20-7:50, 8:00-8:30, 8:40-9:10
Plus Friday and Saturday (PM – EST):
8:40-9:10, 9:20-9:50, 10:00-10:30, 10:40-11:10, 11:20-11:50

Additional summer time slots (June 24th – August 30th EST): 12.5 hrs

Sunday – Thursday (PM-EST):
8:40-9:10, 9:20-9:50, 10:00-10:30, 10:40-11:10, 11:20-11:50

*Payment: the base rate for our teachers is $16 USD per hour, equivalent to 2 lessons. There are attendance and performance bonuses, $1USD each, calculated weekly. With full bonuses, the pay is $20 USD per hour. 

About Qkids 

Qkids is an interactive online teaching platform that connects English teachers to young language learners in real time with fun, user-friendly software. Founded in 2015, we are now a national leader in cross-cultural E-learning with over 100,000 Chinese elementary and secondary students. Connected on our patented and effective game-based learning platform, English teachers from the United States and Canada guide students through a curriculum of fun, dynamic, and engaging narrative gaming adventures from the comfort of their own homes. We are ready to build lasting growth for both learners and teachers, and we pride ourselves on providing the authentic North American classroom experience for our students in China. https://www.facebook.com/JoinQkids/ 

This opportunity: Contract, Part-time, Work from home, remote, Online, Work online, Tutor, English Teacher, Students, stay at home, qkids, teach online

Apply for job

items.title: Sage X3 Consultant - Remote Working
items.content:
Sage X3 Consultant - Remote Working

SAGE X3 Consultant with experience of installation and implementation of Sage X3 ERP software and SQL is required by a major technology company based in South East England. - This offers remote working

You will be responsible for the delivery of quality ERP and Sage X3 implementations and service days. This will include all aspects of the project lifecycle technical assistance, training, business analysis, ERP software specification, implementation, configuration and post-Sage x3 implementation support.

Skills required:

  • Sage X3 or associated ERP software experience ideally in both support and implantation
  • Strong Consultancy and project support experience
  • Ideally some Sage X3 or ERP training experience
  • SQL data manipulation and reporting

The main criteria of the role is to install and implement SAGE X3 ERP and associated software on client sites across the South East. It will be a mixture of office based work, client site work and some working from home. You shall be involved in quality training courses, tailored to the customer's needs, around the SAGE X3 and ERP software

Other duties of the role include using import data into SQL based applications and manipulate data within SQL for reporting. Process documentation and some software testing will be required

My client is one of the leading organisations in the world. They offer a great working environment, a big budget for training and gaining industry accreditations, and can offer some flexible working.

They are looking to pay a starting salary of between £60,000 - £65,000 + Benefits.

To find out more about this or other opportunities then feel free to add me Matthew Recruitment.com on LinkedIn or contact me directly on the head office number on

Circle Recruitment is acting as an Employment Agency in relation to this vacancy. Earn yourself a referral bonus if you refer somebody else who fills the role! We also offer an iPad if you refer a new client to us and we recruit for them. Follow us on Facebook - Circle Recruitment , Twitter and LinkedIn - Circle Recruitment.

items.title: Informatics Coordinator
items.content:
Informatics Coordinator at Cardinal Health

Remote | Entry-level

Location: Telecommuter; United States

Description: The Medication Therapy Management (MTM) Informatics Coordinator, under the supervision of the Lead Informatics Pharmacist, will help maintain the technology infrastructure for the MTM department to support our mission of delivering safe, effective, and affordable medication therapy to our target population. The MTM Informatics Coordinator will be an integral member of the MTM Informatics team to ensure the MTM department meets business goals by ensuring daily operations are carried out accurately and efficiently. The MTM Informatics Coordinator will help support the MTM Solution team in the development, implementation, and maintenance of business applications and will be responsible for ensuring applications are working seamlessly to meet operational goals.

Accountabilities:

  • Provides support to the MTM Lead Informatics Pharmacist, MTM Informatics Technician and the MTM Operations Team by analyzing and sharing data derived from campaign outreach files and business technology (such as telephony).
  • Campaign Management:
    • Coordinates specialized patient outreach dependent on campaign results.
    • Works with Pharmacy Services Center Supervisor to assign Patient Engagement Coordinators to specific campaigns
    • Monitors campaign progress to rally the team and keep energy and enthusiasm high
    • Monitors agents on queue/available
    • Triages issues with campaign feedback received by team members and business
    • Reviews campaign wrap up codes for quality assurance
  • Technology support:
    • Triages telephony support issues
    • Submits and tracks outstanding tickets
    • Monitors Interactive Voice Response (IVR) vendor campaign
    • Adjusts throttle based on inbound call activity
    • Reports and tracks performance
  • Operational Responsibilities
    • Assists with audits by pulling call recordings and completing necessary paperwork
    • Tracks and ensures on time submission of custom and ad hoc reports requested by clients
    • Compiles pertinent information for security quarterly review process
    • Tracks IT downtime incurred by team members
    • Participates in interdepartmental committees when requested and imparts knowledge related to MTM automation and technology.
    • Develops and/or administers other special projects as Cardinal Health MTM Solutions expands
    • Complies with the Cardinal Health MTM Telecommuter Policy and other Cardinal Health specific policies and procedures
    • Ensures all data is treated with care and protects data from inadvertent disclosure to parties who do not have a bonafide need to view/receive said data
    • Ensures operational details are kept in confidence from outside parties
    • Meets performance expectations set forth by manager

Qualifications:

  • High School Diploma Required
  • Excellent Listening Skills present a warm, friendly and empathetic atmosphere by demonstrating active listening techniques
  • Clear and Concise Communication Skills able to articulate information, both verbally and in writing, in a clear and concise manner
  • Excellent Interpersonal Skills demonstrate empathy in tone, language, questions and counseling and demonstrate patience, caring, sensitivity, empathy and cultural competency throughout job responsibilities
  • Conflict Resolution Skills able to defuse potential conflict utilizing the appropriate tone, support, questions or counsel, and ability to respond in a supportive manner to MTM Solutions Team members
  • Strong Work Values able to follow all company and departmental processes and procedures including dealing with sensitive, confidential information
  • Self-management Skills self-motivated, organized and detail oriented
  • Proficient in use of Microsoft Word, Excel, Access, and Outlook
  • Strong data entry skills (alpha and numeric)
  • Able to multi-task using multiple computer databases/platforms/applications
  • Highly proficient in Microsoft Office applications, particularly Excel, Access, and OneDrive. (Proof of skill level may be addressed during interview process.)

Cardinal Health is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or protected veteran status.

Apply for job

items.title: Health Coach
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=2, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=1, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Health Coach at Noom

Remote | Entry-level

Effectively deliver a program that has the power to make tens of millions of people healthier and happier. Hack willpower, save lives and have fun doing it.

Noom, Inc. is a mobile solutions company focused on preventative health. Noom’s research-backed products help people achieve real, positive outcomes. Noom was awarded a grant from the National Institutes of Health (NIH) and was also recently selected as one of seven healthcare startups chosen to participate in the 2014 New York Digital Health Accelerator (NYDHA). Noom’s apps boast more than 32 million installs worldwide and its flagship app, Noom Coach for Android, has been the #1 top grossing Health and Fitness App since 2012 in the Google Play Store. Noom has offices in New York City, Seoul, and Tokyo.

We have created a unique and constantly evolving wellness product, so expect to be constantly challenged! Our team of Health Coaches are heavily involved in rapid prototyping and experimenting with new, cutting-edge coaching tactics and methodologies. Expect to work in a fast-paced environment with constant new projects to tackle. Expect to hear from thousands of people whose lives you changed. You are the face of Noom and sit at the intersection between technology, behavior change, and our users. You’ll work closely with our users every step of their journey, helping them identify goals that will allow them to achieve their ultimate health goals. Sounds like fun? Read on.

What you’ll do:

  • Work with hundreds of individuals to prevent or manage chronic conditions by facilitating healthful lifestyle modifications
  • Pilot experimental coaching protocols and techniques as a part of a test-driven environment
  • Help pioneer innovative ways to merge behavior change with technology
  • Motivate, guide, and help our users navigate through their programs and meet their wellness goals successfully

Who you are:

  • You have a Bachelor’s Degree in a related field of study, OR an Associate’s Degree plus 2000 hours of related wellness experience (sports medicine, personal coaching, etc.)
  • You are very tech-savvy, and are excited by fast-paced change, creative problem solving
  • You are EXTREMELY organized and are a self-starter
  • You love driving people to reach their goals
  • You are passionate about health and wellness
  • You love understanding people– using qualitative and quantitative means
  • Familiarity with the curriculum of the National Diabetes Prevention Program is a plus.
  • Background in psychology and/or nutrition is a plus.
  • Recent grads welcome! This is a great opportunity for those looking for behavioral health/lifestyle management experience

This is a remote temporary position with the potential opportunity for a salaried position after 90 days, based on performance.

You must be available to work 40 hours/week during business hours Monday-Friday.

Apply for job

tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=5, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Compliance Advisor, Senior – Banking, Annuities, Life Insurance at USAA

Remote

Location: San Antonio, TX, United States
Job Category: Risk-Compliance-Audit
Job Desc:

Purpose of Job

We are looking to add a Senior Compliance Advisor with experience in Banking, Annuities or Life insurance products to join our team. This individual can be in our San Antonio Office or Remotely located throughout the US.

Guides and facilitates cross-functional teams in the strategy development and implementation of compliance solutions. Independently performs complex work assignments and problem resolution within a CoSA and enterprise-wide projects. Reviews laws and regulations for business impact and completes risk assessments. Identifies compliance opportunities and potential solutions.

Job Requirements

  • Serves as the subject matter expert to ensure documents, projects, processes or product initiatives comply with regulatory and legal requirements and enterprise policy.
  • Synthesizes analyses, identifies root cause(s), and provides recommendations that influence business solutions.
  • Fosters cooperation across team and organizational units.
  • Builds consensus and morale through understanding of underlying team dynamics and by promoting development of team relationships.
  • Provides compliance input on business action plans, projects or operational requests.
  • Provides insight and guides management on issues.
  • Utilizes strong leadership and collaboration skills interacting with project teams, regulatory agencies, and team members.
  • Responsible for project management by leading and influencing cross-functional enterprise or compliance teams.
  • Ensures proper implementation of business requirements and identifies outstanding compliance issues.
  • Identifies potential compliance risks and coordinates with appropriate Compliance staff.
  • Reviews implementation planning for new laws and regulations and ensures appropriate parties have been engaged.
  • Leads efforts to improve standardization and efficiency of responses to regulators.
  • Applies advanced knowledge of the business, its products and processes.
  • Offers recommendations and makes project-related decisions within scope of work assignment.
  • Develops and delivers all types of messages effectively.
  • Conveys information and position clearly, concisely, logically and in an organized manner.
  • Serves as a mentor to peers and team members for assigned area of responsibility.
  • Serves as a resource to team members on escalated issues of an unusual nature.
  • Mentors and enhances compliance staff knowledge competencies.
  • Demonstrates awareness of personal leadership style and works to achieve quality results by motivating and inspiring highly skilled team of compliance professionals.

Minimum Requirements

  • Bachelor’s degree or 4 additional years experience in lieu of a degree
  • 6 or more years work experience in Annuities and/or Life insurance products.

*Qualifications may warrant placement in a different job level*

When you apply for this position, you will be required to answer some initial questions. This will take approximately 5 minutes. Once you begin the questions you will not be able to finish them at a later time and you will not be able to change your responses.

Preferred

  • Diverse experience in a compliance capacity with Insurance and banking
  • Knowledge of relevant industry regulations
  • Knowledge of regulatory compliance to include experience with Federal and State Examination, Risk management and Mitigation
  • Related industry designations.
  • Experience with product development within Life Insurance and/or Annuities

The above description reflects the details considered necessary to describe the principal functions of the job and should not be construed as a detailed description of all the work requirements that may be performed in the job.

At USAA our employees enjoy one of the best benefits packages in the business, including a flexible business casual or casual dress environment, comprehensive medical, dental and vision plans, along with wellness and wealth building programs. Additionally, our career path planning and continuing education will assist you with your professional goals.

USAA also offers a variety of on-site services and conveniences to help you manage your work and personal life, including seven cafeterias, two company stores and three fitness centers.

Relocation assistance is not available for this position.

For Internal Candidates:

Must complete 12 months in current position (from date of hire or date of placement), or must have managers approval prior to posting.

Last day for internal candidates to apply to the opening is 07/23/18 by 11:59 pm CST time.
Job Type:
C: 6.2475

Apply for job

tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=8, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=2, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Onboarding Assistant at Aviacode Incorporated

Remote

Job Locations: US-Virtual/Remote
Job ID: 2018-1362
# of Openings: 1
Category: Medical Coding
Minimum Hours: 40

Overview

Onboarding Assistant

Are you interested in joining one of the nation’s leading providers of medical coding services that is experiencing impressive year-over-year growth? Aviacode is nationally recognized as one of the top medical coding companies in KLAS and Black Book Market Research surveys. Here is your opportunity to be part of this exciting team! We are hiring now for an Onboarding Assistant (per diem status) 40 hours per week, for one month engagements. This will be per project with two projects scheduled currently. The first project will begin the first part of September.

Responsibilities

  • Assist with System Issues, Connecting Client’s IT with each individual coder as needed
  • Track coder onboarding progress
  • Communication with coders daily on onboarding progress, deadlines and advancement
  • Transfer onboarding results from Aviacode tracking mechanism to Client’s Smartsheet
  • Transfer scores and feedback from Client’s Smartsheet to Aviacode tracking mechanism

Qualifications

  • Must have the ability to multitask in a high paced environment with great attention to detail
  • Good interpersonal skills with effective written and oral communication abilities are required
  • Must have working knowledge of Excel, including formulas, pivot tables, etc
  • Must be detail and quality oriented to ensure information is completed with high degree of accuracy
  • Strong follow through skills and ability to manage process from start to end without significant oversight
  • Business hours required for at least one of the positions, after hours is acceptable for the other
  • Reliable internet provider with personal computer (no MAC pc’s) Windows operating system

items.title: Senior Salesforce Consultant / Engagement Manager (REMOTE OPPORTUNITY)
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=3, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Job Description

Zennify is looking for a qualified candidate to join their team as a Senior Salesforce Consultant with a strong Financial Services Background. The individual will be responsible for managing strategic engagements with clients, including designing and delivering scalable solutions using Salesforce.com and other cloud-based technologies. The individual will work with a team to implement mid- and large-scale customer projects encompassing process analysis & design, system requirements & configuration, change management, training and deployment. Clients range from local, small and mid-sized companies to multi-national enterprise corporations and state and federal agencies.

THIS IS A REMOTE POSITION. Zennify is headquartered in Boise, ID with another office located in Sacramento, CA. Working remote, candidates need to be prepared for up to 30% travel to both headquarters and client locations.

Must be eligible to work in the US as we are not currently sponsoring visas.

Responsibilities

· Lead delivery teams to execute all project implementation phases including project planning, requirements gathering, solution design, development, system and user testing, deployment, training and post go live support

· Manage customer relationships and day-to-day interactions & escalations

· Oversee process driven customer conversations and workshops related to sales processes, customer service, marketing automation and operational processes

· Define project short and long-term goals, identify success criteria, and coordinate client and delivery resource roles and responsibilities

· Drive delivery teams to produce on­-time, high quality, scalable and suitable services and deliverables

· Contribute to pre-sales customer scoping sessions with the Business Development Team & assist with project proposal development

· Contribute to a collaborative team environment by encouraging and leading solution brainstorming, internal knowledge sharing and skill development

Qualities of the Ideal Candidate

  • Thrives in a team-based, high energy and fast-paced environment
  • Service-oriented and innately driven to produce outstanding customer satisfaction and results
  • Enjoys discovering, learning about and implementing new technologies
  • Analytical and prone to logically and methodically work through problems
  • Strong aptitude for prioritization and multi-tasking in a deadline-driven environment
  • A positive demeanor with exceptional interpersonal skills with respect to internal and external interactions and relationships
  • Ability to meet travel requirements, when applicable (no more than 20% travel expected)
  • A desire to proactively contribute to, and enhance, team outputs
  • Experience working in Financial Services or Banking
  • Working knowledge of integration software such as Mulesoft, Jitterbit, Informatica

Preferred Qualifications

  • One or more of the following Salesforce Certifications: Sales Cloud Consultant, Service Cloud Consultant, Community Cloud Consultant, Financial Services Cloud Accredidation
  • Strong Financial Services background
  • Experience working with one or more of the following platforms: Ncino, Core Logic, Orion, Loan Origination Systems
  • Understanding of Core Banking Systems (Fiserv, Symitar, etc)

Company DescriptionAt Zennify, we know how to focus, build and balance. We know systems and can untangle even the most complex of technical messes to ensure everything is running in sync. Our expertise in the Salesforce suite of products has helped bring balance to hundreds of clients. We evaluate existing technologies, recommend unique cloud-based solutions and expertly build solutions. We take into account our clients' specific needs as well as their existing infrastructure to develop context laden, elegant solutions. Simply put, Zennify brings competing interests, incompatible systems and seemingly unlinked challenges into alignment to develop technology solutions that drive businesses forward.

Our team is comprised of gritty, passionate problem-solvers. We have the vision to create lasting, long-term solutions for our clients. Because we view our clients as partners, we're deeply invested in our work and the success of our projects. At Zennify, innovation is in our every breath. We're motivated to increase efficiencies and ultimately help the bottom line of our client's business. We dig deep. Zennify works hard to understand the needs of our clients and align those needs with working, effective solutions.

tags: DBG:surround``2N(work, remot) 2N OR(option, allow, abl, possibl, permit)
DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=1, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Job Description

Company Description:

Harmony Healthcare IT (HHIT) provides technology solutions for healthcare organizations by safeguarding protected clinical information, increasing productivity and maximizing cash flow. We specialize solely in healthcare technology - driving accessibility, security, efficiency and quality for our customers who rely on accurate clinical data to provide care for their patients. We are best known for our excellence in data extraction, migration and retention of healthcare records ensuring system reliability and data integrity 24/7. We are growing and seek to add key members to our team to help continue our mission of helping the healthcare system work better for everyone.

We are seeking a resource with the following skills:

In-depth knowledge of MEDITECH system, including:

  • Modules
    • Accounts Payable
    • Abstracting
    • General Ledger
    • Materials Management
    • Clinical, including EMR
    • Billing and Accounts Receivable
    • HR/Payroll
  • Understanding of the following MEDITECH technologies/features/challenges
    • EMR view
    • Purging
    • Meditor Files
    • Other system generated files
  • Understanding/access to MEDITECH programs/stored procedures used to calculate certain columns
  • Understanding of MEDITECH Magic, Client Server, and 6.x
  • Understanding of the hierarchical MEDITECH data structures used to house the data
  • SQL, specifically Microsoft SQL Server
  • Potentially (nice-to-have) working knowledge of basic ETL functions

Overview of Responsibilities:

  • We are ideally looking for someone to come on-site to our South Bend office for a couple of weeks to learn our process and the scope of the upcoming MEDITECH projects. After that, the ability to work 100% remote is possible.
  • This resource will be asked to create views to meet the customer requirement. Strong knowledge of MEDITECH and how all the data relates together is required to be successful in this role.
  • Depending on the scope of the extract (already provided from another vendor), this resource would, potentially, be responsible for creating system generated documents out of the MEDITECH database once extracted.
  • We will also rely on this resource to have a strong understanding of the calculated fields in MEDITECH and, potentially, have access to the logic itself and the ability to 'decode' it.
  • This resource would report to the Director of ETL & Data Management
  • No MEDITECH extraction is required for this role - this includes NPR reports
  • All IP would become the property of Harmony Healthcare IT and we would be free to use it on future projects

Company DescriptionHarmony Healthcare IT provides technology solutions for healthcare organizations by safeguarding protected clinical information, increasing productivity and maximizing cash flow. We specialize solely in healthcare technology - driving accessibility, security, efficiency and quality for our customers who rely on accurate clinical data to provide care for their patients. We are best known for our excellence in data extraction, migration and retention of healthcare records ensuring system reliability and data integrity 24/7. We are growing and seek to add key members to our team to help continue our mission of helping the healthcare system work better for everyone.

Job Description

THIS IS A REMOTE POSITION - YOU CAN WORK ANYWHERE IN USA

Kelly Services , a global leader in staffing solutions, is seeking Senior Statistician for a remote project.

Don't miss out - this is the job you've been looking for!

This is an exciting opportunity to work for a multinational pharmaceutical and biopharmaceutical company!

Responsibilities:

  • Provides statistical expertise for complex design and interpretation of clinical programmes, regulatory submissions and commercialisation
  • Analyses internal and external information to inform design decisions and the development of decision criteria
  • Develop a Statistical Analysis plan for complex studies and/or project deliveries
  • Acts as a coach/guide for less experienced statisticians in the production of analysis, supporting graphics and analysis tables for CSRs, GMA studies or publications
  • Provides support to the complex study analysis, regulatory submissions including specification of overview documents and response to regulatory questions
  • Able to interpret, summarise and communicate results of complex studies
  • Contribute to the regulatory submissions including specification of overview documents and response to regulatory questions
  • Identifies opportunities for the application of modelling and simulation to improve study design
  • Identifies opportunities to improve the methodology and provide practical solutions for problems
  • Identifies and applies statistical methodology to improve the process and delivery activities
  • Contributes to the development of best practice to improve quality, efficiency and effectiveness

Minimum Qualifications:

  • MSc/PhD in Statistics or Mathematics(containing a substantial statistical component) preferably with experience in pharma/healthcare or other relevant area
  • Knowledge of the technical and regulatory requirements related to the role and can guide others
  • Experience of Development, programme design and data analysis and interpretation
  • Experience of regulatory, commercial or early development support work
  • Good Communication skills
  • Leadership and team working Skills
  • Project Management Skills
  • Coaching Skills
  • Expert Statistical programming skills (SAS and R)

items.content:
Inpatient Facility Coder at Aviacode Incorporated

Remote

Job Locations: US-Virtual/Remote

Job ID: 2018-1356

# of Openings: 1

Category: Medical Coding

Minimum Hours: 40

Overview: Inpatient Facility Coder – Full Time. Are you interested in joining one of the nation’s leading providers of medical coding services that is experiencing impressive year-over-year growth? Aviacode is nationally recognized as one of the top medical coding companies in KLAS and Black Book Market Research surveys. Here is your opportunity to be part of this exciting team. We are hiring now and have an immediate need for an Inpatient Facility Coder.

Responsibilities:

  • This position will be responsible for medical coding for one of our larger facility clients.
  • Coder will be responsible for reviewing charts, coding appropriate charges and ensuring high quality standards are achieved.

Qualifications:

  • RHIA, RHIT, or CCS required
  • Minimum five years inpatient coding experience in facility setting
  • The Inpatient Coder is responsible for assigning diagnostic and procedural codes to patient charts using ICD-10-CM, ICD-10-PCS or any other designated coding classification system in accordance with coding rules and regulations. The coder will abstract required clinical information. This position requires a thorough knowledge of medical terminology, disease processes, pharmacology, Medicare’s Inpatient Prospective Payment System (IPPS), Official Coding Guidelines for ICD-10-CM and ICD-10-PCS codes, and documentation requirements for correct and accurate coding.
  • Maintain standard industry productivity rates for Inpatient coding (3 charts/hour)
  • Demonstrated ability to maintain high quality standards of 95% or greater
  • Proficient in utilizing technology (computer, VPN, MS Office, coding software) to perform responsibilities
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills
  • Must have ICD-10 coding experience and have completed an ICD-10 course
  • Experience with trauma and highly complex cases, orthopedic, and cardiology preferred
  • Must pass candidate assessment test with a minimum score of 85%.
  • This position is a full-time virtual/work from home position.

Aviacode provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identification, disability, or genetics. In addition to federal law requirements, Aviacode complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities. items.title: Digital Sales Consultant
items.content:
Digital Sales Consultant

North America
Company: Vortala Digital

FULL-TIME

Overview

In 2004, Steve Anson and Bill Esteb founded Vortala with a simple vision to help doctors grow their practice using the Internet.

Today, our dedicated team of 70 marketing professionals serve thousands of healthcare practices worldwide. Busy doctors trust Vortala to manage their practice website and lead their digital strategy.

Our core values are Trust, Service and Innovation. Our team culture is based on practicing an Outward Mindset which is the simple idea that, “our success is a by-product of helping others succeed.”

Does our culture fit with your work and life philosophy?

Our brands include,  (allied healthcare),  (dental) and we’re expanding into other healthcare verticals.

ABOUT THE ROLE

You’ll be supported by our inbound marketing and outbound prospecting teams who will stimulate a consistent flow of sales qualified meetings.

Their goal is to keep your diary full with new, high quality sales opportunities.

You’ll report to the Director, Sales & Marketing and assume responsibility for selling digital services to dentists, chiropractors and other healthcare professionals.

Specific role responsibilities include:

  • Leading phone or videoconference discovery meetings with qualified prospects. Your objective to uncover the doctor’s practice vision and new patient marketing goals.
  • Liaising with internal digital specialist (Design, SEO, PPC, Email Marketing and Social Media) to craft digital strategies for prospects.
  • Presenting digital strategies to prospects, fielding their questions, overcoming their objections and closing sales!
  • Managing a sales follow-up regime to nurture qualified prospects and improve sales. The typical sales cycle is 4 – 6 weeks.
  • Providing feedback to our marketing and prospecting team to constantly improve the quality of our sales and marketing process.
  • Connecting with Account Managers to assist with up-selling current clients to new service plans, paid traffic services, social media plans, etc.

HOW TO SECURE AN INTERVIEW

To be invited for interview, you should possess:

  • Proven consultative selling skills in a professional service environment.
  • A working knowledge of digital marketing for small businesses.
  • Advanced proficiency with CRM software (e.g. Salesforce) and other marketing technologies.
  • Advanced phone and written sales communication skills.
  • Maturity to self-manage and balance personal achievement with supporting your peers to achieve their goals.
  • Sales experience in the health sector (including dental, medical or chiropractic) is advantageous but not essential.

Our mantra is, “the company can only grow as fast as its people.” This means we’re committed to your ongoing personal and professional development. Including weekly individual and team development activities and attending the company’s annual retreat. This is a full-time position with flexible, family-friendly hours. You’ll work from the comfort of your home office and connect with your colleagues worldwide using the most advanced online collaboration tools. Vortala is a fast-growing, equal opportunity employer riding the healthcare and technology wave.

Ready for a new challenge with a company that cares deeply about you and your development?

Apply for job

items.title: Academic Consulting Firm Hiring Consultants
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=5, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
1.) Who we are:

We are a medium sized, cloud-based consultancy headquartered in Las Vegas, NV, USA, but with consultants spread across the globe, from Asia to South America. We primarily handle Academic Consulting for Doctorate level clients, and are currently hiring Academic Consultants.

Each position is a strictly work-from-home position, and any applicant should view this as a strong incentive. It’s vital that any potential applicant is extremely comfortable working very long hours (60+ is normal, 70 is not abnormal). The first 3 months are paid training, where pay is $3500/month. After 3 months, pay will be $3500 + bonus, where bonus will be between $0-$4000 monthly, and the expectation is the average bonus size will be $2000. The more you work, the more you get paid. It’s very normal for a successful first year consultant to make $60,000-$70,000, with these numbers reaching $80,000 by year 2.

2.) Job responsibilities for the Academic Consultant position:

The entirety of this job will be handling communications with existing and potential clients of the company, both in terms of managing existing services as well as selling new services, as well as reviewing and delivering work from independent contractors. You will you need to be able to manage expectations, and build long-lasting relationships with all of your clients. Note there is no cold calling of any kind.

3.) Requirements:

Applicants must possess a meticulous nature and an extremely high attention to detail.

Excellent command of the English Language. Native English speaker.

Post-Graduate Degree or higher, preferably from a good university.

Virtually all of our successful applicants have some background in competitive gaming (chess, poker, blackjack, etc) or have been professional academics; as such, a background of this nature is STRONGLY preferred.

All applicants must pass an UNPAID assessment, which is fairly extensive, that tests the following skillsets of any applicant.

A. Ability to review work deliverables in comparison to assignment details

B. Ability to respond properly to client requests and concerns

C. Ability to speak to clients properly by phone

D. Knowledge and background in qualitative research, ability to speak at a high academic level with clients and explain our service offerings and how it would help them with their work.

All applicants will be required to undergo the assessment before hiring decision is reached.

4.) Compensation:

All candidates, regardless of qualifications, must pass the assessment in order to be considered for the position. All candidates will receive the exact same assessment. All candidates will receive an immediate $500 signon bonus if they are onboarded for training (which is also paid at the $3500/month rate)

items.title: Coaching Consultant
items.content:
Coaching Consultant at Chopra Center

Remote | International

Do you want to be part of our team of superstars who make a difference in the lives of others? Are you Humble, Heart-Centered and possess a Whatever It Takes attitude? The Chopra Center is currently seeking a Coaching Consultant.

The Chopra Center for Wellbeing attracts seekers from around the world who long to experience healing and transformation. Combining the ancient wisdom of meditation with the latest scientific research in cognitive development, our life coaching programs allow individuals to identify their dharma, expand their awareness, heal the subconscious and manifest their desires.

We are the leading source for meditation, yoga, and the ancient wisdom of Ayurveda. We offer a wide variety of programs in stress release, mind-body medicine, emotional healing, personal development and life transformation. The Chopra Center is a 2013 Medallion Award Winner of the San Diego Society for Human Resource Management (SHRM) Workplace Excellence program.

The Coaching Consultant will report to the Coaching Sales Director. As a Coaching Consultant, you will work remotely from your home office and will be responsible for closing leads from inbound lead requests. At least 30 hour-long consult openings should be made available weekly. Ability to convert prospects into high-ticket programs is a basic requirement to succeed in this job. You will be responsible for maintaining on-going relationships with leads in your sales pipe via e-mail and phone calls. The position offers a base plus generous commission structure.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Responsible for contacting new and existing clients to discuss their needs and to explain how these needs could be met by our coaching services.
  • Quote prices, credit terms and other bid specifications.
  • Answer customers’ questions about products, prices, availability, and product uses.
  • Maintain client records, using automated system.
  • Prepare sales contracts for orders obtained, and submit orders for processing.
  • Conducting sales presentations via the phone and internet.
  • Collaborate with colleagues to exchange information such as selling strategies and marketing information.

EDUCATION AND/OR QUALIFICATIONS:

  • Bachelor’s degree preferred
  • Bilingual in Spanish strongly preferred
  • Work experience should include a minimum of 2 years in sales or sales support, and 2 years in customer service, public speaking, or training role
  • Must be sales and goal oriented
  • Effective ability to communicate orally or in written form effectively with co-management, internal and external customers
  • Ability to work individually and as part of a team
  • Knowledge of Sales Logic Software very helpful

BENEFITS

Our staff members work hard and in return we offer a ton of incredible benefits, exclusive to the Chopra Center:

  • Work from home, anywhere in the world
  • Access to many of our digital materials and programs
  • Discounts on Chopra Center products and services including Medical Consults, Acupuncture, Pranic Healing, Life Coaching packages and more!
  • The chance to work with an amazing team of talented, goal-oriented people who are passionate about health and wellness!
  • That amazing feeling of satisfaction that comes from knowing that what you do truly does make a difference!

HOW TO APPLY

If you would like to be considered for this opportunity please email your resume AND unique cover letter explaining why you are our ideal candidate to coachingteam@chopracentercoaching.com. The subject line of your email must say I am your new Coaching Sales Consultant.

Due to the high volume of resumes we receive, please note that we will only be contacting those we feel best meet the qualifications of this position.

Apply for job

items.title: Senior Compensation Consultant
items.content:
Senior Compensation Consultant at Magellan Health

Remote
  • United States
  • Full-time
  • R00000018719

Responsibilities:

  • Assists in the development and implementation of various compensation programs and policies, and ensures these programs and policies are administered properly and in accordance with legal guidelines.
  • Supports assigned business groups company-wide by providing analyses, recommendations and guidance to HR Business Consultants (HRBCs) and business group managers to ensure consistent application of compensation guidelines, policies, and practices that support prudent compensation decision making.
  • Conducts annual benchmarking and modeling for assigned business group(s).
  • Works closely with the Compensation Technologist to identify and test new Workday configurations.
  • Assists and monitors annual and quarterly compensation processes for assigned business group(s) as appropriate.

General Job Information

Title Senior Compensation Consultant – REMOTE Opportunity!

  • Grade 26
  • Job Family Compensation
  • Country United States of America
  • FLSA Status United States of America (Exempt)

Minimum Qualifications

Education

Bachelors: Business Administration (Required), Masters

License and Certifications – Preferred 

CCP – Certified Compensation Professional – Enterprise

Other Job Requirements

  • Eight or more years human resources experience with a minimum of four years of experience in compensation.
  • Experience in compensation program design and administration, data analysis, job evaluation, and salary survey participation are essential.
  • Knowledge of FLSA regulations is required.,
  • Experience using Workday, MarketPay, and Service Now preferred.,
  • Knowledge of designing salary structures and job evaluation techniques.
  • Knowledge of incentive plan design and modeling.
  • Excellent analytical problem-solving abilities.
  • Must be able to proficiently manipulate large amounts of data and conduct analysis, run reports in various software applications and summarize for decision making or official reporting.
  • Advanced Microsoft Excel skills.
  • Intermediate Microsoft Word and PowerPoint skills.
  • Strong customer service skills including timely follow-up on outstanding issues/problems.
  • Ability to effectively communicate, both verbally and written, with peers, employees, managers, Human Resources and Finance personnel in a professional manner.
  • Ability to perform a majority of tasks of an independent nature, work under pressure and here to tight deadlines in a fast-paced environment.
  • Ability to maintain a high level of confidentiality, work independently, and handle stress effectively despite short time constraints while displaying a can-do attitude.,
  • Sales compensation experience, specifically creating and maintaining sales commission plans, highly desirable.

Magellan Health Services is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer and a Tobacco-free workplace. EOE/M/F/Vet/Disabled

Apply for job

items.title: Auditor, Outpatient
items.content:
Auditor, Outpatient at LexiCode

Remote
  • Remote
  • Position Type: FULLTIME
  • Requisition ID: 6417
  • Level of Education: 2 Year Degree or equivalent
  • Years of Experience: 5+ to 7 Years

Job Summary/Objective

LexiCode, the leader in health information coding and consulting services, has full-time opportunities available for several Consultants with experience and expertise in Outpatient coding to audit client medical records and provide valuable facility and coder feedback. These positions will work remotely from home.

Essential Functions and Responsibilities

  • Performs concurrent ICD-10 and CPT coding analysis of medical records to validate code assignment.
  • Applies Official Guidelines for Coding and Reporting consistently and appropriately.
  • Provides written explanations to support or rebut audit recommendations.

Qualifications

Required:

  • RHIA, RHIT, or CCS credential from AHIMA
  • 5 or more years of coding experience, with emphasis and expertise coding Outpatient services
  • Excellent knowledge of Official Guidelines for Coding and Reporting as well as AHA/AMA/CMS coding resources to support audit findings
  • Aptitude in the use of computer applications, including MS Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint)
  • Excellent written communication skills
  • Ability to efficiently review large volumes of documents with high comprehension level

Preferred:

  • Auditor or Lead Coder experience
  • Experience with various health information systems, EHRs, grouper software

LexiCode Offers

  • Excellent compensation
  • Computer with 3M coding resources plus coding books provided
  • Full-time work as an employee, this is not a contract position
  • Continuing education and free CEU’s
  • Insurance benefits include; health, dental, vision, life, and disability
  • Paid time off and paid holidays
  • 401(k) retirement savings plan
